Iâ€™ve ordered four times and never had a problem. The shirt quality is perfectly fine and Iâ€™ve washed them a ton with no problems whatsoever.
I am surprised at the negative reviews but if you read many of them closely you can see a pattern that has nothing to do with the product.
Please people - these are $20 t- shirts- what do you expect anyway? Buy a few shirts with fun graphics, wear them for a while and move on.

originalText.text:
A Warning to Fellow Artists and Designers!

I've been a professional graphics designer for over 35 years, dedicating my career to creating original designs and contributing positively to various platforms. However, my experience with TeePublic has been nothing short of appalling, marking a first in my career for being treated with such a lack of respect and fairness.

Without any prior warning or clear explanation, TeePublic removed all my designs and deleted my account. Their justification was a vague reference to a violation of terms and conditions, yet they failed to provide any details on the supposed infringement. As someone who prides themselves on originality and compliance with platform rules, this accusation is not only baseless but also damaging to my reputation.

Efforts to seek clarity and resolution were met with automated responses and a lack of personal engagement. Despite following their suggested steps for appeal and providing necessary evidence to prove the authenticity of my work, the response from TeePublic remained non-existent. This lack of communication and transparency is unacceptable and unprofessional, especially for a platform that relies on the creativity and contributions of its designers.

To add insult to injury, TeePublic continues to send promotional emails daily, despite my inability to unsubscribe from them or to get a response to my inquiries. This disregard for basic customer service and respect for artists and designers is alarming and should serve as a cautionary tale for anyone considering contributing their work to TeePublic.

In my 35 years of professional experience, I have never been treated so poorly. I entered this partnership with TeePublic in good faith, spending considerable time preparing my artwork for their platform, only to have my efforts dismissed without justification. My intention here is not only to express my disappointment but also to warn other creators about the potential disrespect and disregard they could face from TeePublic.

I encourage fellow artists, designers, and potential collaborators to consider this experience carefully before engaging with TeePublic. The way a company treats its contributors reflects its values and integrity, and from my unfortunate experience, TeePublic has shown a profound lack of both.

In solidarity with fellow creators,
Jerry

originalText.text:
As a seasoned graphics designer of 22 years, my appalling experience with TeePublic is a first. They axed my account and designs without warning or explanation, citing a vague "terms violation." Attempts to clarify were met with silence, despite my impeccable track record and adherence to their rules. Their customer service? Non-existent. While they ghost my requests for explanation, they spam me relentlessly with promos, adding insult to injury.

TeePublic's disregard for artists and lack of transparency is not just unprofessional; it's downright disrespectful. I've invested time and creativity into their platform, only to be discarded like yesterday's news without so much as a proper explanation. And their communication? A joke. Iâ€™m left fighting spam instead of celebrating creativity.

To my fellow creators: consider this a HUGE RED FLAG! TeePublic has shown zero respect for artists. Don't waste your time and talents on a platform that treats its contributors with such disdain. If they think they can silence us without consequence, theyâ€™re wrong. Iâ€™m speaking out to ensure others donâ€™t fall into the same trap.

originalText.text: Just got my order from TeePublic today, arrived on time, design was well made and printed, quality of shirt is good. For $20. I'd say this was a really good buy, 10/10 will order from them again ðŸ˜„

originalText.text:
I googled drums and veteran gifts. And up popped the best gift I could have ever given my dad! Heâ€™s a career musician (drummer) whose life was forever altered by The Vietnam War. His entire life has been playing drums and being a disabled vet. When I came across this shirt my eyes filled up! Especially to realize this was an artist who created this precious gift was heart warming as my brother is a career artist (painter) so we get the significance of buying his work.
I cant say Thank you enough! I think my dad might cry when he opens this! **
Picture of him wearing it coming soon!
